title: UK weather forecast: Two weeks of rain expected in wind-battered October washout

Downpours look set to continue for the rest of the month, according to a long-range weather forecast from the Met Office .

Wet weather is expected once again today, with the Environment Agency issuing 11 flood warnings across England.

A further 65 flood alerts are also in force - raising the prospect of possible flooding.

The Met Office weather forecast for October 19 to October 28 states: "Saturday should see sunny spells and scattered showers, some heavy and thundery at times and often windy.

(Image: PA)

"Looking ahead, the unsettled theme is set to continue with showers and longer spells of rain, especially in the west and northwest.

"There should be some brief episodes of more settled weather with bright and sunny spells. It will often be windy across most areas, particularly in the north and west with coastal gales possible.

"Temperatures should remain around average for this time of the year, although it may feel colder at times in the wind and rain.

"In the short-lived settled periods of drier and clearer conditions, there is the potential for some overnight frost or fog, which would be slow to clear."

Temperatures today will peak at 16C, dropping to lows of 7C in parts of Scotland tonight.

This evening will be dry with a few clear spells across central and eastern areas.

There will be cloud and outbreaks of rain in the west.

Through the night rain will spread eastwards across the country, some of which will be heavy.

Tomorrow will be mostly cloudy with outbreaks of rain in the morning, especially in the north and east.

(Image: PA)

In the afternoon, it will become dry with spells of sunshine for most but rain is expected to persist in northern and eastern Scotland.

One or two showers are possible in the west too.

Thursday will be mostly dry with sunny spells in the west.

There will be patchy cloud and frequent heavy showers in the west, some of which will be thundery.

There will be further heavy showers on Friday, especially in the south and west.

Met Office five-day weather forecast

Today:

Sunny spells and a few showers for southern England, whilst western Scotland sees the best of the weather and is largely fine and dry. Elsewhere, rather cloudy at first before occasional bright or sunny spells develop for some later.

Tonight:

Wet and windy weather with rain, heavy at times, spreads eastwards reaching all but the far east of the UK. Clearer, drier conditions follow into Northern Ireland by dawn.

Wednesday:

Cloud and rain, heavy at times, moves eastwards across the UK, finally clearing far southeast England early evening. Brighter weather follows, albeit with a few showers over western UK.

Outlook for Thursday to Saturday:

Windy with sunshine and blustery scattered showers. These mainly in the west on Thursday extending to all areas through Friday and Saturday. Winds easing on Saturday with temperatures around average.
